comments.text:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win95; en-US; rv:1.7.10) Gecko/20050716 Firefox/1.0.6 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win95; en-US; rv:1.7.10) Gecko/20050716 Firefox/1.0.6 Page (source below) has taken over my URL for http://www.library.vcu.edu. Instead of seeing the VCU Libraries homepage, I see the login page for the Red Lion Inn "Net4Guests") I have cleared history and cookies without success. I have uninstalled Mozilla and reinstalled without success. Problem does not replicate in IE. Welcome to Net4Guests
     
 
 

Not a GuestAwards member?

 

Permanent crew card members, click here to log on

 

 

Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Stay at Red Lion Inn SeaTac Airport 2.Login to wireless network 3.At home, access to homepage prevented by Red Lion Inn login screen Actual Results: Unable to get to homepage after using Red Lion Inn wireless network Expected Results: Discontinued accessing Red Lion Inn wireless network after deletion of cookies and history. I have been unable to resolve this problem with Red Lion Inn.
comments.author: peps7611@comcast.net
comments.creator: peps7611@comcast.net

comments.creator: rflint@ryanflint.com
comments.raw_text:
It's possible that you may have inadvertently set the RLI page as your homepage.
Are you able to return your homepage to http://www.library.vcu.edu through the
Tools -> Options -> General menu?
Otherwise I see nothing in the source of that page would enable it to hijack
your homepage. And we certainly can't replicate this ;)

Recommend -> INVA

comments.text:
Many wireless networks automatically redirect you to a specific page no matter
what page is requested for payment collection. Your homepage should return to
normal after leaving that network, otherwise jsut change it back as per comment 1.
comments.author: dtownsend@mozilla.com
comments.creator: dtownsend@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Many wireless networks automatically redirect you to a specific page no matter
what page is requested for payment collection. Your homepage should return to
normal after leaving that network, otherwise jsut change it back as per comment 1.

My home page settings in Tools/Options are set for the VCU Libraries homepage. The settings do not reference "Net4Guests" or Red Lion Inn in any way. I am out of the Red Lion Inn network. There seems to be no reason why this "Net4Guests" page persists. I have uninstalled Mozilla, reinstalled, cleared history and cookies. Problem persists. I have posted the code from the Red Lion Inn Page. Below is the code from the home page I want. Red Lion Inn and VCU Libraries says it's a problem with Mozilla. VCU Libraries

comments.raw_text:
We are not here to offer support with your problems with Firefox. That's what
the MozillaZine forums are for. This is an isolated incident and is most likely
being caused by some "crap" that you have on your computer. Please use the
MozillaZine forums for further support, and do not reopen this bug.
http://forums.mozillazine.org/
comments.creator: ispiked@gmail.com
